snippet: Just one of 23 Afghan brigades is able to operate on its own without air or other military support from the United States or NATO, a report found.
abstract: Pentagon report assessing stability in Afghanistan finds that only one of Afghan National Army’s 23 brigades is able to operate on its own without military support from United States and NATO partners; report also finds that Taliban remain resilient and that violence there is higher than it was before 2010 troop surge; publication comes at important juncture in war, as Pres Obama considers how quickly to withdraw remaining American forces.
lead_paragraph: Just one of 23 Afghan brigades is able to operate on its own without air or other military support from the United States or NATO, a report found.
